triageFlags.title: Excessive Loan-to-Value (LTV) Ratio
triageFlags.description: The LTV ratio significantly exceeds the maximum allowable for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the proposal as the LTV ratio is not compliant with policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier B applicants is 100%. The current LTV of 224.44% is far above this limit, indicating an over-leveraged loan structure.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income (DTI) Ratio Exceeds Threshold
triageFlags.description: The DTI ratio exceeds the maximum allowable for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the proposal as the DTI ratio indicates affordability concerns.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 40% for Tier B applicants. The current DTI of 55% suggests the applicant may struggle to meet the financial obligations of the loan.

content.reasoning: The analysis identified critical violations of the underwriting policy, including an LTV ratio far exceeding the maximum allowable for the applicant's credit tier and a DTI ratio that surpasses the threshold for affordability. These factors collectively indicate a high risk of default.
